description: League Two leaders Walsall shrug off the loss of top scorer Nathan Lowe to beat MK Dons for a club record-extending ninth straight league victory.
title: Walsall 4-2 MK Dons: League Two leaders claim ninth straight win
title_page: Walsall 4-2 MK Dons: League Two leaders claim ninth straight win - BBC Sport
maintext:
Walsall have won just one of their last five home league games against MK Dons (D2 L2), though have kept a clean sheet in each of their last two such matches.
MK Dons have won each of their last two league games against Walsall by a combined 6-0 scoreline, and will be looking to win three in succession for the first time in the EFL.
Walsall have won each of their last eight league games in succession by a combined 18-4 scoreline. The Saddlers have never registered a nine-match winning streak in the EFL.
After winning each of their six league games between mid-October and early-December, MK Dons have since won just one of their last six EFL outings (D1 L4), failing to keep a clean sheet during that time.
